summary: Guy Ritchie's The Covenant follows US Army Sergeant John Kinley (Jake Gyllenhaal) and Afghan interpreter Ahmed (Dar Salim). After an ambush, Ahmed goes to Herculean lengths to save Kinley‚Äôs life. When Kinley learns that Ahmed and his family were not given safe passage to America as promised, he must repay his debt by returning to the war zone to retrieve them before the Taliban hunts them down first.

reviews.content: Casting was good and story line was good

Guy Ritchie's The Covenant differs from the director's usual fare, but with excellent performances by Jake Gyllenhaal and Dar Salim, tense action, and stellar character-based drama, it proves to be an exhilarating and emotionally satisfying war thriller!

This movie was fantastic! I absolutely loved the leadership role of John Kinley.  Jake really killed it in this film.  I also loved the amount of emotion that was shown throughout the film through all the different actors.  They nailed that section as well.  Action sequences were intense, and had me on the edge of my seat!  Overall a must see!
Jake is painfully underrated good ass movie and Anthony starr was good as well even tho small role

I'm a huge Guy Ritchie fan, This movie was great! One of Guy Ritchie's best in my opinion! Would highly recommend this movie. Very well put together. Good soundtrack, acting, storyline.  Best movie I've seen in a while.
Amazing movie.  Was totally consumed the entire time.  Great acting.
Our bonds are what connect us. If we forsake them, will we have anything at all?
Never been a big Gyllenhaal fan, but I am now. Best war movie in quite a while.
Good story line, great action movie, very intense scenes  , highly recommend.
I really enjoyed this movie. It check all my boxes. Good story, good acting,  good action , some good drama and at 10.50 matinee price, well, all good for me.
One of the most thrilling movies in recent years!

Sincerely one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. Acting, action, drama, even the music all amazing! I've never written a review for a movie before, I made an account and wrote my first review so this movie would get all the love it deserves.
Great script, great actors, great score/soundtrack, great movie!
Non stop edge of your seat. Acting is great you genuinely care about the characters
Very good story -tough (emotionally) to watch at times. Slight let down at the end, thought it would have been at little more touching than a head nod.
Wonderful! SEE IT 300000 times
Excellent ‚Äî long past time to go get those we promised VISAS!!  Biden‚Äôs Afghan withdrawal was horrendous!!
I LIKED EVERYTHING ABOUT THE MOVIE. SHOWS EXAMPLES OF TRUE BONDING, CARING, FRIENDSHIP OF YOUR FELLOW HUMAN BEING NO MATTER WHAT THE PERSONS RACE IS!!
Enjoyed it - but a little long
Great movie! Bringing awareness to the truths of war and the effects of it. Whether good or bad.
Trust is everything!!
Loved the storyline and acting. Should make more movies like this
allot of action , true reality of war

Overall, this was a thrilling movie that spread awareness of the mistreatment of Afghani interpreters by the U.S. Military. Though it was a long watch, I felt immersed in the story for most of the movie. Dar Salim gave an amazing performance. However, I thought Jake Gyllenhaal's acting was somewhat superficial, making it challenging to feel touched by his role in the film.

Wow.  I've never written a review before, but I need this movie to get all of the love and attention that it deserves.    This just easily became my number one favorite movie. This is a crazy emotional roller coaster.   Will put you in all the feels. That, along with the visuals.... just wow.
Incredible story. Worth watching for sure.

Absolutely stellar.  Fine acting, interesting premise of getting our interpreters out of Alfghanistan which I remember us trying to do, and all about honor and commitment, which, sadly seems to deserted us in today's world.  Time went by quickly and my husband, a Veteran, and I both really enjoyed all of it.

SERIOUS REFLECTION OF OUR PRESENCE IN A WAR WHERE WE SHOULD NEVER HAVE BEEN... CLEAR HOW WE ABANDONDED THOSE THAT GAVE ALL THEY HAD, INCLUDING LIVES AND FAMILIES... FOR US.  THANKS MR. RITCHIE... GREAT BOOK AND SUPER MOVIE... TRULY WELL DONE.
Excellent film, very well directed and Jake is from the best actors in America I can't wait till it's streaming so I can watch again.
Tense movie from beginning to end. Excellent acting by Jake Gyllenhall. Definitely should be considered for picture and acting awards. Would absolutely recommend this movie to anyone.
Timely story with a realistic plot (more so than the Hurt Locker). Also,  Gyllenhaal is better than Renner. Great action, portrays the real sacrifices of our military, on par with Lone Survivor.
The movie felt very real and accurate.   It was intense and action filled
Probably the best movie Ive seen in years
Suspenseful, great acting and revelant to events that did and still are occuring today.

Great movie.Kept my attention the whole 2 hours and 3 minutes. Underlying message  is how America should be ashamed of itself with breaking the covenant it made with thousands of Afghan people who were promised visas for themselves and their families in return for their help in the war.America's disgraceful exit from Afghanistan insured we will never get cooperation from citizens of other countries during a war effort.
I loved the movie. The movie kept you on the edge of your seat.
Very very very good movie.
great action and ever better acting
Awesome. Great story, great character arcs. Great action, great acting. Must see for sure!
Best movie I‚Äôve seen in awhile

Good action movie with a bit of drama.  Really enjoyed the firefight scenes.  If you like military movies good chance you'll enjoy this.  Everyone I went with enjoyed it as well.only thing I kind of didn't like was some of the extended scenes felt like some of it could have been cut down a little.
This movie represents the apex of humanity and strength
One of the best movies I have seen in a while.
My blood pressure and heart rate were high through out the whole movie! Must watch
Great movie, story told well.  A little long in some scenes but all together a very good movie!
Excellent movie. Lots of continuous action. Very intense and exciting . Great story

Great movie , Very emotional and an exciting movie for adults. Also an important message regarding war and our obligations and loyalty as a Country and as individuals  I think it is Guy Ritchie's best movie to date. Great acting and awesome cinematography  !
The point of the film is to remind us that we had a deal with our translators in Afghanistan, we as a country, the government which represents us, must keep the promise me made. Well done!
Amazing movie! Amazing actors, amazing sound effects and amazing graphics & costume design too!

Very moving movie‚Ä¶ depicts honor between American soldiers and war interpreters. Depicts leadership, friendship, great sacrifice, and  love for family and country. Among so many other things, at the beginning of the movie I realized how valuable and necessary interpreters are.  This is a movie that impacts hard‚Ä¶. I left the theater wanting to do more to help those left behind and to stand up, even sacrifice for what is true and honorable.
This IS a true , real story - nonfiction, true history‚Ä¶
Read several places that seemed to want to make it out as fiction- this is real and worth seeing and believing.

Loved and recommend this movie. It was full of action and suspense. Kept me on my toes throughout the entire movie. A must see.  Will not dissapoint. One thing I advise movie goers. Do not take your small children. It is not for them.
Very well done, exciting story.
Amazing movie! Very impactful! One of the best meaningful military movies I have seen. Definitely go see!
Movie was really good

The Covenant was so much better than I even expected! First of all, the acting was excellent. Second, the action was top-notch and edge-of-your-seat. The fact that it was based on a true story just makes it that much better. Highly recommended!
Yes, the actors must be congratulated for a great showing!
One of the BEST movies I've ever seen! I would see it again and again. Our Military are Real Life Superhero's. There are some really good people in the world too that still care about humanity.
Very intense action!  Good flick
Very intense.  Loved it.  Would watch it again.
Great movie, well done. The actors should be proud of their motion picture.
On the edge of your seat, wanted to grab a rifle and pitch in. Realistic for a change.
Heart-stopping and hold-your-breath action! Excellent movie!
Great movie that tells a story that needs to shared and even acted upon!
Very Good. Well done!
Thrilling and emotional.
A grateful US soldier doing everything he can to save his afghan interpreter who saved his life. Excellent movie that it's fun to watch. Plain and simple go and enjoy this great movie.

The first half was very good, but it did feel rushed in the last half when Sgt. Kinley returns home.   Also, the scenes with the phone calls seemed to be a bit much just to show the frustration with the visa process. Overall, it's a very good movie with a story that needs to be told about the interpreters in Afghanistan.
Good action. Great cameras. But the acting leaves a little to be desired. Great concept just missed a lead role. 6.5/10
Reflect on the 2 main characters but just try not to reflect on the ones we left behind.

I don't know why Guy Ritchie's name needed to be branded all over the film; regardless, it was surprisingly taught, impactful, and not overly jingoistic.

While the conflict in Afghanistan is the backdrop, the film is more concerned with the weight of promises and relationships, and it doesn't come across too heavy handed. Well-staged and dynamically executed action scenes keep the film humming along as well. 

Whether it's through home video ship or legs in the theaters, this film will eventually find its audience.
Great story.  Good character development.  Nice to see a story showing the faithfulness of an American to honor his commitment, even through push back from above.
War movie,  Action throughout.  Showed a commitment to comrades and sacrifices made by loved ones.
Riveting, 2hours of action.
did not see it as I had no way of going
We loved this movie! It did not disappoint!  Great story and actors!
Fun! A new style for Guy Ritchie, me and my family like it.
An absolutely superb movie. The realistic portrayal of the Afghanistan War and great acting is amazing.
Fantastic we enjoyed it twice now

AMENDED REVIEW This was an outstanding film, done in Guy Ritchie's typically gritty cinematic style. Jake Gyllenhaal knocked his role out of the park! I think he is one the must underrated actors of his era...everything he does is spot-on!

This is a story about John Kelly aka Jake Gylleynhaal a us soldier and his interpreter Dar Salim of there journey of survival and gives you action pack full of emotions and shows the dramatic stress from both sides of the characters another great film directed by Guy Ritchie.
Setting looked authentic as to how I expect Afganistan to look.  It was gripping to see how the two characters were so committed to each other's well being.
Once again, Jake gives a stellar performance. Wonderful story great acting great action. Cinematography was spectacular. One of the best movies of the year along with Jesus revolution.

These reviews are way, way off. This was a structural and storytelling mess, with long drawn out scenes that needed editing, and no memorable moments of action or camera work. The dialogue is boring, and it's a paint by the numbers war movie which won't be talked about in less than a year, filled with mismanaged scoring. It was pretty to look at, was mis-paced, and generally a dull 2 hours. Incredible how this is being reviewed right now. Nothing special to see here, and this director is clearly in need of excellent producer assistance to anything worth watching. I was underwhelmed by every technical element of this story, which at times seemed to almost patronize the dumb cows it imagines the modern audience to be with giant text overlays explaining what certain acronyms and jingoisms mean, but not all of them. It's a mess. 5/10
Great movie! Not a war movie but about obligation and honor! We‚Äôll done!
Fantastic film about the realities and consequences of commitment. Carefully crafted witty dialogue, deep and resonating messages and freagin excellent action sequences. Guy Ritchie is back!
Loved this movie so good!!
Great story and acting!!
It's a beautifully shot movie with plenty of intense moments to keep you glued to your seat

Guy Ritchie refuses to be typecast and triumphantly succeeds in it, forgoing his usual barbed quips and bare-knuckle brawls for a deeply emotional, searingly intense war drama that will make your heart pound and throb in equal measures.
Heartfelt and extraordinary movie. Love the action and the 2 main characters.
It could have contained more "story line" and less violence.  The acting was good.
A true must see for any veteran, but may bring up some painful memories.
The movie made me realize what is going on in Afghanistan. Movie was extremely well done, acting was fantastic.

A great story, told well, and brilliantly acted. It grips you from the start, and the ending is very cathartic.

Good Movie, well done

Guy Ritchie knows how to make an action-suspense movie.  The lead role with Jake Gyllenhaal & his supporting roles with Ahmed & Johnny Lee Miller & the extraction teams were great.  The sets, the plot, the suspense, the special effects, everything was great and to be expected from Guy Ritchie.  Loved this movie, I felt like I was suffering in the desert with everyone else, it really reeled me into the plot.  5-stars, best action movie this year so far

Wow.  Really great movie.  Every seat in the theater should be filled to see this movie.  Complete reality, great music, great acting, great story, and a view into what really happened in Afghanistan.
WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!  AMAZING ACTING - AMAZING STORY - WILL SEE IT AGAIN, FOR SURE!!!!!!!!

This is constantly seen throughout the movie such as them using the baby‚Äôs age to show how much has passed since there initial escape.

This movie is based on a true story, it is two hours long and it keeps you actively intrigued the entire time. 

This is such a great war, movie, a movie based on Afghanistan. 

It is gut, wrenching, and Jake Gyllenhaal does a phenomenal job in the lead role, he really is a fantastic Actor. I'm not sure why people just don't flop to the theaters to support him. 

But this movie is very well written, very well, directed, and Guy. Ritchie definitely deserves Oscar nominations from this film, that's how great I think this film is. 

Little man loved every moment of the film that he didn't budge an inch, he was so glued to the screen and watching this film, and when he got out, he told me how much he loved it. 

I highly recommend check in this film out in theaters.

A MUST SEE‚Ä¶if not now in theaters rent it at home but big screens only. 8 stars for this cast, Jake and Dar and Guy Ritchie.

Best movie of the year! Gyllenhaal delivers an amazing performance with an equally amazing by Salim. The action sequences are spectacular. I wanted to see this because I care so much that we didn't keep our word to all those Afghan interpreters that helped us. This movie was great- intense, exciting, realistic, with great acting and screenplay. Goosebumps! Solid A.

As the two-decade-long war in Afghanistan relentlessly raged on, the US military hired scores of locals to serve as interpreters in the conflict against the Taliban, a risky proposition for these Afghan nationals, given that they were seen by their countrymen as traitors. In exchange for their services, however, they were promised a hefty reward ‚Äì visas to emigrate to America for themselves and their families. Nevertheless, this promise often came with undisclosed strings, particularly lengthy delays for issuing the documents, leaving the interpreters in the lurch as they anxiously awaited their flight to freedom. Their story is the subject of "Guy Ritchie's The Covenant," an amalgamation of the interpreters' wartime experiences told through the tale of a heroic translator, Ahmed (Dar Salim), who rescues his commanding officer, Sgt. John Kinley (Jake Gyllenhaal), under perilous conditions but who is subsequently forced into hiding after his story receives widespread attention and makes him a highly valued Taliban target. When Sgt. Kinley is safely at home and hears what happened to his colleague, he vows to return to Afghanistan to secure refuge for the man who saved his life. Movies about extricating those trapped behind enemy lines are common in the annals of filmdom, and this offering is very much cut from the same cloth (save for the venue), so there's not much that really differentiates it from comparable offerings. However, the film's superbly executed second half ‚Äì a far cry better than its overlong, sometimes-tedious first hour ‚Äì helps to make up for this. The back end also features far better writing than what's found in the trite, corny war movie dialogue of the opening act. And it helps that the picture has a superb score and is beautifully shot. It's just unfortunate that the two halves of this release aren't on par with one another, as that would have made for a much better film, even with a narrative as fundamentally formulaic as this one. I must admit that I'm always somewhat skeptical about movies that have an individual's name at the beginning of the title (makes me think the studio/distributor is trying too hard to sell it, based on the individual's reputation than the quality of the work at hand), and I suppose I should have maintained more of that skepticism where this film is concerned. While "The Covenant" is far from a bad picture, it certainly could have been better (or at least better balanced), and then it wouldn't have had to rely on the director's name at the top of the marquee to coax viewers into the theater.
A must see for everyone.

Even though it borders on fantastical, I think that the movie asks the question: what amount of sacrifice will it take for the US to honor its commitments. The reality of getting interpreters safe lives in the impossible world of government burocracy which is clearly not what the interpreters are led to believe. I feel though that the movie is soft on that topic even though it feels like it will take that step forward and call out the government for its lack of accountability. (Spoiler alert) The protagonist finds a way and is owed enough favors to get things done but that's not how things are in the real world . I think what the movie does a good job of is continue to highlight the fact that there is a debt to be paid and small or large, sacrifices were made by locals to help with the mission success of the US (the big picture). My opinion, interpreters and their families should be moved to US housing to protect them while the paperwork takes place. This is written by a veteran and my reality is , a brother is a brother regardless of circumstance.

The Covenant is a gripping and gritty action thriller that showcases Guy Ritchie's signature style of fast-paced storytelling, witty dialogue, and stylish visuals. The film stars Jake Gyllenhaal as Sergeant John Kinley, a U.S. Army soldier who recruits and befriends Ahmed (Dar Salim), an Afghan interpreter with a personal vendetta against the Taliban. When their platoon is ambushed in the desert, Ahmed saves Kinley's life by dragging him through the mountains, evading the enemy. Years later, Kinley learns that Ahmed is still in danger and decides to go back to Afghanistan to rescue him, defying his superiors and risking his own life.

"The film is a thrilling ride that keeps the audience on the edge of their seats with its intense and suspenseful action sequences and emotional stakes. It also explores the themes of friendship, loyalty, courage, and sacrifice in the context of war and its aftermath. The film does not shy away from depicting the harsh realities of war and its impact on both soldiers and civilians, but injects some humor and humanity into the dark situations."


"The film's strong performances by the lead actors, who have great chemistry and charisma on screen, elevate its emotional impact. Gyllenhaal delivers a nuanced and compelling portrayal of Kinley, a soldier grappling with PTSD and survivor's guilt while exhibiting compassion and determination. Salim is equally impressive as Ahmed, a complex and conflicted character who finds hope and courage in his friendship with Kinley despite having lost everything to the war. Additionally, the supporting cast does a solid job, particularly Alexander Ludwig as Kinley's rival Sergeant O'Brady, Antony Starr as Kinley's former friend Eddie Parker, and Emily Beecham as Kinley's wife Caroline. The impressive cinematography by Ed Wild captures the stunning landscapes of Spain, which double as Afghanistan, and the gritty urban settings of the U.S., while the dynamic score by Christopher Benstead blends traditional Afghan music with modern electronic beats to create a fitting soundtrack for the film."

The Covenant is a well-made and entertaining action thriller that showcases Guy Ritchie's skills as a filmmaker and storyteller. The film offers a thrilling and emotional journey for its characters and its audience, with some memorable scenes and performances. The film may not be very original or profound in its depiction of war and its consequences, but it is still an engaging and enjoyable watch for fans of the genre.

This superbly crafted "war" movie is thoughtful, well constructed and tells a compelling story of a US Army Sgt. who is badly wounded and is dragged through the mountains and deserts of Afghanistan to save his life by his Afghan interpreter who is viewed by the Taliban as a traitor and pawn of the Infidels, the non-Taliban.  Guy Richie films it smartly with excellent use of drone cameras and the moments of peril feel very real.  The tension is very real and Jake Gyllenhaal is terrific as the lead.  His Afghan co-star is very, very believable and carries the film equally.  For lighter moments the soldier to soldier banter plays well to decrease tension but sets a good stage for a surprise battle that is just around the corner.  This film is reminiscent of Lone Survivor from the battlefields.

Movie keeps you engaged from beginning to end. Action scenes are bitter sweet when thinking about those that gave the ultimate in the real world. Kudos to those that had a part in telling this story. Not based directly on a true story, but a combination of compelling real events that took place.
Another Guy Ritchie treat. Such talent and style
Intense, incredible movie. Fantastic action and suspense. Don‚Äôt miss this movie.

A very well produced movie of the Afghanistan war that is brutal and emotional around the bond between an Afghan interpreter and his American military sergeant. Although not based on a true story it blends many aspects of the Afghan war and the failure of the military establishment to return Afghan interpreters and their families to the United States After promising them visas for their work in the war.

It was an intense movie. Very interesting and well done.

Some of the dialogue felt very scripted and unrealistic. Totally great. The cinematography, acting, pacing, and music was all perfect. Dar Salim was a total surprise and a knockout character. Jake G was great as always. Guy Ritchie added a great use of interesting camera angles in Afghanistan, dark tones as a military vet dealing with trauma, and the need to fulfill a personal debt. I have a feeling a lot of people aren't going to see this, but once it's out on streaming everyone will start talking about it.

Caught this in a sneak preview/early release last week. It was a fantastic film from start to finish. The film felt like it was trying to not check every other war movie box, the dialogue was crisp and concise, and was delivered perfectly by the actors. The gunfights were clean and very realistic, it did not view as an "action" movie. 

The tension was palpable throughout the movie even without a word being spoken. This was absolutely an emotional film for all involved. Loved it.

A very powerful movie referencing the Afgan War, a must see marvel of a movie though heavy on the violence and portrayals of war. In my opinion, it may not be real nor the characters are real people though it is based on the creator's experience and narrative.

I absolutely loved the movie.. Jake GYLLENHAAL IS ALWAYS great, but his lead beside him stole the show. A very complicated, good man, that shows strength during adversity. The action was great, the premise was great, the acting was top notch.

The movie is a must watch. My fellow anxiety folks, breathe!! I absolutely love the story behind the scenes. Terrible and sad it's the truth. And the last quote on the last scene is just heartbreaking, but very true. Many lost their life. Others are living in a cave. All for what? The US of A. Great (eye roll). But the movie targets and hits good point! Felt like it was only like a 40 minute movie there was so much anticipation and eagerness.
A different kind of Guy Ritchie movie, with the same kind of heart as his other movies. Brotherhood and commitment is still a common theme.

It was your average netflix war movie. American sniper, lone survivor, 13 hours all beat this movie by far. Movie is a lot like the Outpost. Kinda of a over colored, action shot, intense music type of movie. Story plot is great, and a lot of intense moments that seem a little unrealistic. Almost as if a call of duty mission was made into a movie. Wait until it comes out on your tv. Go watch the Nike air movie instead

Although not technically a "true story, "still a phenomenal story and film. Acting was superb; Dar Salim who plays Ahmed was phenomenal as was Gyllenhaal (no surprise there), LOVED the soundtrack as it was more edgy and less stereotypical. Love how the film explores/highlights the positive relationship between the US military and the Afghani people.
Great movie eight out of a ten very good adapted film.

The movie is amazing and I am a veteran of the U.S. Army. This movie is really authentically realistic in its portrayal of life. I had an interpreter in Iraq that went out on several dozen missions with me. Eventually, he asked for aid to become an American citizen. As an NCO, I hand wrote a letter to help him in that endeavor. Later, I found out after many years, he finally made it to the USA.
